3cc03f4d-5da7-48ce-9025-37e1dcf1ba42.description: The earner learned to define, plan and execute projects on time and on budget while meeting performance specifications. By exploring components of project management and the project life cycle, the earner determined the correct methodologies through strategic portfolio analysis. The earner created a project charter, assembled and managed a team, analyzed and controlled risk, monitored milestones, and closed the project. Course aligns with the PMBOK; providing 35 education hours.
3cc03f4d-5da7-48ce-9025-37e1dcf1ba42.name: Project Management Boot Camp

issuer.summary: issued by UC San Diego Extended Studies

alignments.name: Project Management Institute
alignments.description: Earner can submit to PMI 35 training hours to be counted towards contact hours required to sit for PMI Credentials or towards Professional Development Units (PDUs) required to maintain PMI Credentials.

badge_template_activities.title: The earner demonstrated an understanding of the main tasks related to initiating, planning, executing, monitoring and controlling, and closing projects. The earner can develop a project plan, and perform a basic project risk assessment. The earner is able to define the key elements needed to measure and report on project scope, schedule, and cost performance.

As part of a team, the earner worked on a simulated project with detailed project requirements. Throughout the four-day course, the earner progressively built on their understanding of project management by applying lessons learned to a real-world scenario.

The earner completed a detailed project simulation culminating in a team project presentation and submission of project artifacts, which included: a Project Charter/Scope Statement, Stakeholder Register/Analysis, Kick-off Meeting Agenda, Organizational Chart, Work Breakdown Structure, Business Requirements, Project Plan, Communications Plan, Risk Register, Business Case (Cost Benefit Analysis), Issue log, Project Change Control, Project Status Report, and Lessons Learned Statement.

skills.name: Project Management Body Of Knowledge (PMBOK) Methodology

55f59808-31f8-4d2d-9fea-a985e54f0dca.description: The Earner has demonstrated the knowledge and skills needed to design a successful Lean Six Sigma Green Belt project by following the DMAIC process and leveraging lean methodologies of eliminating waste. The project was based on an actual workplace process that was projected to save at least $40k in hard savings upon implementation of the solution. Earners receive 40 educational hours of training equaling 4 Continuing Education Units (CEU).
55f59808-31f8-4d2d-9fea-a985e54f0dca.name: Lean Six Sigma Green Belt

issuer.summary: issued by UC San Diego Extended Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Define: Earner created a project charter and developed SIPOC diagram to define voice of the customer requirements and build a high-level map of the process.
Measure:  Earner created a process data collection plan by selecting measures, planning for data collection, and collected data to build baseline graphs.
Analyze:  Earner created fishbone diagram and hypothesis statement by conducting process and  data analysis, and then brainstorm and validating root causes of process problems.
Improve:  Earner created a solution selection matrix that filters and determine solutions to process problems and then mitigated the risks of process change.  Built a storyboard for the project.
Control: Earner created monitoring and response plans, and documented the project.
Earner passed comprehensive exam covering Lean Six Sigma definition and concepts, the DMAIC process, and the lean methodology.
Earner presented Lean Six Sigma Green Belt project to Master Black Belt for sign-off.
Earner performed workplace waste walk on location.

1d12024c-e3fe-4842-a15f-b18ee251f93a.description: Earners completed five months of comprehensive training in the following areas of leadership: Unconscious Bias, Emotional Intelligence, Impactful Communication, Power and Influence, Diversity/Inclusion/Belonging, Generations/Culture/Gender, Performance/Talent Management, High-Performing Teams, Innovation, Data-Driven Decision Making, Accounting and Finance, Business Writing, Marketing, Organizational Change and High Impact Presentations.
1d12024c-e3fe-4842-a15f-b18ee251f93a.name: ACE Senior Leadership Program

issuer.summary: issued by UC San Diego Extended Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Earners created a variety of significant business writing projects linking program content to current business issues.
Earners wrote a targeted Executive Brief.
Earners participated in a Group Project designed to identify and solve critical business issues.
Earners created a High-Impact Group Presentation focusing on a critical business issue.
Earners wrote an expository Reflection Paper focusing on the program's most impactful components and how the components will positively impact the earners' leadership styles and best practices.

86363ce2-afa4-4308-952a-7327835a0e0f.description: The earner demonstrated the skills needed to design a successful Lean Six Sigma Black Belt project based on an actual workplace process projected to save at least $100k in hard dollar savings upon implementation. The earner shows competency in understanding the ‘DMAIC’ method of process improvement and leveraging lean methodologies of eliminating waste. Earner completed all examinations and projects assigned during the course under a certified Lean Six Sigma Master Black Belt Master Instructor.
86363ce2-afa4-4308-952a-7327835a0e0f.name: Lean Six Sigma Black Belt

issuer.summary: issued by UC San Diego Extended Studies

alignments.name: Project Management Institute
alignments.description: Earner can submit to PMI 45 training hours to be counted towards contact hours required to sit for PMI Credentials or towards Professional Development Units (PDUs) required to maintain PMI Credentials.

badge_template_activities.title: Earner passed comprehensive exams covering each phase in the DMAIC process.

Define Phase: Earner created a Project Charter, developed a Primary Metric, SIPOC, Roles Worksheet and Stakeholder Analysis. They also established a VSM with OEE metrics, accompanied by an 8 Wastes Gemba walk and 5S analysis.

Measure Phase: Earner completed Detailed Process Maps, assessed the reliability of Measurement Systems, created a Data Collection Plan, and completed a baseline Process Capability Analysis. Earner is trained in various Lean toolsets, such as SMED and Total Productive Maintenance.
Analyze Phase: Earner utilized various graphical analysis tools, such as Pareto Charts and Boxplots. Earner developed a Hypothesis Testing Plan and conducted various hypothesis tests.

Improve Phase: Earner is trained to conduct a Full Factorial 2k DOE for process characterization and/or Fractional Factorial 2k DOE for screening; developed solutions and created a Solution Selection Matrix, which was then Piloted and Implemented.
Control Phase: Earner utilized SPC charts to develop Process Monitoring. Earner created a detailed Control Plan with monitoring and response elements and built a project storyboard.

f2ef8b4a-4fd7-44e1-a564-950ad9a4eccd.description: This leadership program emphasizes team interaction, communication, problem-solving, personal reflection, and peer coaching. Topics within the program provide the earner with immediate tools and skills to apply in the workplace. The curriculum relies heavily on case studies and business simulations to offer timely, relevant and specific application to the modern organization. This program provides 60 hours of education or 6 credit units.
f2ef8b4a-4fd7-44e1-a564-950ad9a4eccd.name: Essentials of Leadership & Management Program

issuer.summary: issued by UC San Diego Extended Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Earners completed a rigorous set of modules starting with a personalized DiSC assessment, Conflict & Resiliency, Building and Sustaining High-Performance Teams, Improving Emotional Intelligence, Performance and Talent Management, Understanding Business Finance, Unconscious Bias, Employment Law, Diversity and Inclusion, and Effective Coaching. Additional topics are also discussed.
Earners displayed evidence of application of new skills in their workplace through self-reflections, coaching, and discussion.
Earners successfully completed the detailed business and team-building simulation modules.
Earners attended required sessions and actively participated in training activities including discussions, debates, exercises, and assignments.

75c83718-4494-4502-92d4-678417bc9713.description: Breaking through conflict is necessary in order for leaders to keep team members on track to meet targets. Earners learn how to power through disagreements by getting to the root of the real issues, turning negative energy into action, and successfully helping players work together to accomplish goals. Earners uncover reaction to adversaries and how to modify personal or team behaviors to align more with the vision of the organization, and create an authentic and compassionate culture.
75c83718-4494-4502-92d4-678417bc9713.name: Dealing with Conflict Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by UC San Diego Extended Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Earner attended and participated in a 4-hour workshop.

1e3997fe-a559-4b55-b8c1-bdb3288308f4.description: This training explores and addresses the challenges of planning, designing and providing “Impactful Presentations;” introduces strategies to authentically connect and engage customers, clients, employees, staffs, and teams whether presenting live or in a virtual setting; and offers strategies, tips, and tactics to enhance and design presentations. Success depends on taking key steps to design a presentation that engages and connects people with ideas, concepts, products, services and solutions.
1e3997fe-a559-4b55-b8c1-bdb3288308f4.name: Impactful Presentations: From Preparation to Delivery Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by UC San Diego Extended Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Earner attended and participated in a 3-hour workshop on Impactful Presentations: From Preparation to Delivery.

ed40bfdf-2cc9-445f-b76a-d6bfb9a66a60.description: Emotional Intelligence (EQ) is an important skill set for anyone who wants to maximize potential as a leader. EQ is proven to be a key indicator of success in group or team environments. This half-day workshop provides earners with tools to understand the vital elements of EQ and discover blind spots that may have prevented earners from being effective leaders. Topics include: understanding what EQ is, the impact EQ has on relationships, individual performance, and overall success.
ed40bfdf-2cc9-445f-b76a-d6bfb9a66a60.name: Emotional Intelligence Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by UC San Diego Extended Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Earner attended and participated in a 3-hour workshop on Emotional Intelligence.

1097cec6-2f95-4f18-b47c-503cfa52b0df.description: Business leaders today are short on time more than ever. Their days consist of meetings, emails, presentations, text messages, instant messages, and more. With their attention being drawn in many directions, strategic writing and communication is a must. Earners learn the foundations of effective business writing with a focus on clear, concise, and direct content. From emails to proposals, participants will improve their writing and communication in the context of today’s business environment.
1097cec6-2f95-4f18-b47c-503cfa52b0df.name: Effective Business Writing Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by UC San Diego Extended Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Earner attended and participated in a 4-hour workshop on Effective Business Writing.

cc0857f3-bc76-4ac3-9683-11b32f427b8b.description: Unconscious biases (implicit biases) are social stereotypes about certain groups of people that individuals form outside their own conscious awareness. As a result, we sometimes make judgments and decisions based on faulty assumptions. While these assumptions are usually harmless, they can wreak havoc in our decision-making at work if they go unchecked. This workshop helps identify unconscious biases and provide practical tools to keep those biases from negatively affecting our decisions.
cc0857f3-bc76-4ac3-9683-11b32f427b8b.name: Recognizing and Managing Unconscious Bias Workshop

issuer.summary: issued by UC San Diego Extended Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Earner attended and participated in a 4-hour workshop on Recognizing and Managing Unconscious Bias.
